name: .SKM File Extension
summary: Learn about .SKM files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An SKM file contains material information used by Trimble SketchUp, a 3D modeling application. It is a Zip-compressed package that stores .XML texture property files and typically includes a thumbnail .PNG image and .JPG texture image. SketchUp users utilize materials saved in SKM files to layer 2D graphics on 3D models.

content: Trimble SketchUp is utilized in architecture, interior design, film, urban planning, video game design, and mechanical engineering industries. You can save your 3D designs in the SketchUp Document .SKP format and apply materials stored in SKM files, such as asphalt, concrete, wood, and carpet textures, to the designs.
SKM files come packaged with the software, and you can use them interchangeably in Windows and macOS. You can find SKM materials in the following directory in Windows:
In macOS, you can navigate to the folder storing the packaged SKM material files by following these steps:
Navigate to the "SketchUp" app in your "Applications" folder.
Navigate to Contents → Resources → Content → Materials.

instructions: You can only open SKM files with Trimble SketchUp. To add an SKM file to use the material it stores, place the SKM file in the application's "Materials" folder. You will then be able to access it in the Materials window in SketchUp.

Since SKM files are Zip-compressed packages, you can also open them with an archive utility, such as Windows File Explorer or Apple Archive Utility. You may need to rename the .skm file extension to .zip for the compression utility to recognize it. After you extract its contents, you can view the XML, PNG, and JPG files that comprise the material.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
